Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> TestNG lets you define dependencies on methods (which is fragile) and on
> groups, which is much more flexible since adding test methods to groups
> doesn't force you to adjust your dependencies.

A Runner that did this for JUnit 4 would not be hard to write, but it is 
not part of the core functionality. As a matter of fact, I was thinking 
about a blog post about writing a new Runner for JUnit 4: this might be 
a good case study.

As much as possible, we've tried to follow the open-closed principle as 
much as possible: the framework is open to extensions that implement 
features like dependencies or groups, without requiring another new 
release of JUnit to support it, or new UI's to display it.

Thanks,

David Saff
